meanings.definition: Relating to the sense of touch.
meanings.sent1: The haptic feedback on the phone made it vibrate when I touched the screen.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the haptic experience of running her fingers over the soft fabric.
meanings.sent3: The haptic gloves allowed the magician to perform tricks by feeling the objects in the dark.
meanings.sent4: The haptic sensation of the rough bark under his palm reminded him of the tree's age.
meanings.sent5: The haptic nature of the warm sand between her toes brought back childhood memories.

meanings.sent1: The haptic game controller provided realistic feedback during the race.
meanings.sent2: The artist used haptic techniques to create a textured painting that could be felt.
meanings.sent3: The haptic handshake between the robots was a sign of their agreement.
meanings.sent4: The haptic connection between them was so strong, they could almost feel each other's presence.
meanings.sent5: The haptic interaction with the sculpture allowed visitors to explore its contours.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the perception and manipulation of objects using the sense of touch.
meanings.sent1: The haptic technology in the virtual reality headset simulated touching objects in the game.
meanings.sent2: The haptic feedback in the surgical robot helped the doctor feel the tissues more accurately.
meanings.sent3: The haptic interface allowed users to navigate the virtual world by touch.
meanings.sent4: The haptic control panel enabled precise adjustments through tactile feedback.
meanings.sent5: The haptic feedback suit allowed the astronaut to feel objects in space simulations.
